poem:
"Towers of Industry"

Concrete choirs that sing no notes,
Architectural gems of a vanishing boat.
Looming large against cloud-dappled sky,
Monuments of industry, whispering goodbye.

Graceful giants in their muted hue,
Casting long shadows as the hours accrue.
In the space of memories, forever they stand,
Echoes of prowess, etched in the land.
